thread.title: Photo tour: Virgin Australia's new Brisbane lounge, terminal
thread.title_full: Photo tour: Virgin Australia's new Brisbane lounge, terminal - Australian Business Traveller

author: Chris Chamberlin
title: Photo tour: Virgin Australia's new Brisbane lounge, terminal
text:
Virgin Group founder Richard Branson officially unveils Virgin Australia's new lounge, Premium Entry facilities and terminal today at Brisbane Airport, and Australian Business Traveller was on the scene to bring you these exclusive snaps.
Virgin Australia Brisbane Premium Entry
For business class passengers and Velocity Gold, Platinum and The Club members, the journey starts at Premium Entry : a fast-track straight from Brisbane's new valet parking area into the lounge via private and dedicated security screening lanes.
If you're not using the valet parking facilities, just look for the purple Premium Entry sign:
You're greeted in a rather spacious room with calming music in the background...
... after which you can clear security and ascend the escalator up into the lounge proper...
... or take the stairs and glance back at Virgin Australia's signature 'Flying Maiden'...
... or up at the roof and its impressively-designed skylight:
Virgin Australia Brisbane lounge
Today's Brisbane lounge represents a complete overhaul, re-build and expansion on the previous facility which debuted in 2011, and which we're sure was worth the wait.
Seating and facilities
Now absent of any construction hoarding, the lounge feels particularly airy and spacious...
... and boasts a plethora of seats for busy business travellers to get things gone:
While the table depth looks rather minimal above, it's actually more than adequate for full-sized laptops...
... which can be charged via desk-level power points, with spare USB slots for your iPhone or tablet:
Naturally, Virgin's comfy plush chairs also make an apearance...
... as does a business centre with computers, printing and photocopying facilities:
Speaking of business, if your wallet wields an invitation-only Virgin Australia The Club card, look for this obscure walkway to your left after taking the escalator from Premium Entry...
... along which you'll find the 'secret' door into your private lounge:
Read more: Perks of The Club, Virgin Australia's secret VIP tier
New espresso & wine bar
As first seen in Virgin Australia's Melbourne Airport lounge , Brisbane too boasts an espresso and wine bar...
... and one that's capable of producing up to 10 cups of coffee at a time during the morning rush:
There you'll also find Peroni on tap, and well-signed ordering and collection points:
During quieter times, we also found the staff offering coffee to passengers seated directly behind the bar...
... and while that's not full 'table service', per se, it's nice to have fresh coffee appear next to you when you're busy typing away.
Other food & beverage
Staff are also on-hand to serve alcohol from 11am including beer, wine and cider...
... in a completely new servery that also boasts the usual soups, toasted sandwiches...
... meats, salads and dressings...
... and a fresh supply of apples:
There's also a self-serve coffee machine on the far side of the lounge...
... more apples, and a handy soft drink dispenser:
Other amenities
The restrooms and showers have moved from where they were previously: now found near the centre of the lounge on the terminal side...
... with that corridor also leading to a newly-built exit-only door to save backtracking via reception if your flight departs from the end pier.
Add to that a variety of reading material...
... flight information screens throughout the lounge...
... and an extended version skylight, intertwined with VA's signature roof leaf pattern...
... bringing plenty of natural light into the lounge.
Also read: Inside Virgin Australia's new Darwin Airport lounge
Follow Australian Business Traveller on twitter: we're @AusBT
About Chris Chamberlin Chris lives by the motto that a journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step, a great latte, an opera ticket and a glass of wine!

Google+: Chris Chamberlin Share this story Airline News Airport News Hotel News Lounge News Frequent Flyer News Reward Program News Tech News Travel Gear News Other News Search News Latest News Latest News Marriott plans new Dubai Edition hotel Branson: Virgin Atlantic may return to AU Photos: Virgin's new Brisbane lounge Qantas boosts Sydney-HK flights LifeMiles: discount Star Alliance flights New BA First for Boeing 787-9 Have something 4 report reply 1 1 hour, 57 minutes ago by Fonga
Fantastic, looks like Virgin is well ahead of the game in Brisbane.
And may well have the advantage in Perth soon when their new domestic terminal opens. I rate the easy connection with the International terminal over the new Qantas business lounge as tipping things the V way.
Two key markets where they offer the better on-ground product.
Now if they could only tone down the purple...
-1 report reply 2 43 minutes ago by Tom It will be intresting on what the Qantas lounge will look like once they make-over their lounge.
1 report reply 3 32 minutes ago by TravelElephant WOW!!
One of the best lounges that I have ever seen. Very luxurious. Can't wait to see other Brisbane lounges. e.g. Qantas makeover lounge.
1 report reply 4 26 minutes ago by deany83 I've never been a fan of the Virgin Australia design style, all the white and purple but that skylight is absolutely stunning.
